posts.title: Final Flesh
posts.excerpt: One of the most ridiculous, absurd, excruciatingly unerotic and genuinely laugh-out-loud funny movies you’ll ever see. Is this satire? Is it philosophy? Video art? Unappealing porno? Hour-long schadenfreude trip? It’s all of these and so much more. Final Flesh is a feature film produced in four parts: the script written by Vernon Chatman (PFFFR, Wondershowzen, …

posts._title: Wilhelm Prager – De olympische spelen AKA The Olympic Games, Amsterdam 1928 (1928)
posts.title: De olympische spelen
posts.excerpt: Quote:Spanning fifty-three movies and forty-one editions of the Olympic Games, 100 Years of Olympic Films: 1912–2012 is the culmination of a monumental, award-winning archival project encompassing dozens of new restorations by the International Olympic Committee. The documentaries collected here cast a cinematic eye on some of the most iconic moments in the history of modern …

posts._title: Carmen Leroi – Pour Elsa AKA For Elsa (2020)
posts.title: Pour Elsa
posts.excerpt: In a large building in a Parisian district, Elsa lives alone. Her young neighbor Alice hears her playing the piano at home and enjoys it. Elsa suggests that she learn the piano and offers to play it at home, when she is not there. Alice thus gets into the habit of living in Elsa’s apartment …

posts._title: Emmanuel Finkiel – La douleur AKA Memoir of war (2017)
posts.title: La douleur
posts.excerpt: Quote:June 1944, France is still under the German occupation. The writer and communist Robert Antelme, major figure of the Resistance, is arrested and deported. His young wife Marguerite Duras, writer and resistant, is torn by the anguish of not having news of her and her secret affair with her comrade Dyonis. She meets a French …

posts._title: László Nemes – Türelem AKA With a Little Patience (2007)
posts.title: Türelem
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:An office clerk as seen during her daily routine – all the little vibrations of her face. And a man, impatiently waiting for her, beyond the windows.

posts._title: Sacha Guitry – Le nouveau testament AKA Indiscretions (1936)
posts.title: Le nouveau testament
posts.excerpt: Based on Guitry’s own stage play about a sanctimonious fellow who eventually’s victimized by his own hypocrisy. Little effort’s made to “cinematize” the property, which’s filmed just as it was staged.

posts._title: Sacha Guitry – Mon père avait raison (1936)
posts.title: Mon père avait raison
posts.excerpt: After being left for another man by his wife, Charles Bellanger raises his only son to fear and suspect women. Years later, such an education is bearing fruit.

posts._title: Jean-Gabriel Périot – Nos défaites AKA Our Defeats (2019)
posts.title: Nos défaites
posts.excerpt: Quote:Périot’s inspired third feature invites French high school students to reenact key scenes from RESUMPTION OF WORK AT THE WONDER FACTORY, WITH THE BLOOD OF OTHERS, Godard’s LA CHINOISE and other 1960s and 70s films which deal with radical politics. These reenactments are intercut with discussions that explore what, if anything, the subjects of these …

posts._title: Claude Chabrol – Une affaire de femmes AKA Story of Women (1988) (HD)
posts.title: Une affaire de femmes
posts.excerpt: A housewife in Nazi-occupied France struggles to make ends meet when her husband returns home after being wounded in the war. posts.title: State Department: File 649
posts.excerpt: U.S. Foreign Service officer matches wits with a Chinese warlord to try to save American citizens threatened with execution.
